title: Creating a reading list on causality in natural language processing (NLP) involves selecting articles that cover various aspects of causal inference, causal reasoning, and their applications in NLP. Hereâ€™s a list of 20 articles up to 2022 that you might find useful
- While not specific to NLP, this paper provides foundational knowledge on causal inference
**"Causal Inference in Natural Language Processing: Estimation, Prediction, Interpretation and Beyond"** by Amir Feder et al
- A comprehensive survey on causal inference methods applied to NLP tasks
- Discusses generating and reasoning about counterfactuals in narrative texts
**"Do Neural Language Models Overcome Reporting Bias?"** by Aida Nematzadeh et al
- Investigates the impact of reporting bias on language models and causal inference
Language Models for Causal Inference"** by Amir Feder et al
- Introduces a BERT-based model for causal inference tasks
**"Causal Mediation Analysis for Interpreting Neural NLP: The Case of Gender Bias"** by Tianlu Wang and Su Lin Blodgett
- Explores causal mediation analysis to interpret gender bias in NLP models
**"Learning to Ask Causal Questions"** by Xinya Du et al
- Focuses on generating causal questions from text using machine learning
**"Causal Embeddings for Recommendation"** by Yixin Wang et al
- Discusses causal embeddings and their application in recommendation systems, relevant for NLP-based recommendation
**"Counterfactual Data Augmentation for Mitigating Gender Stereotypes in Languages with Rich Morphology"** by Hila Gonen and Yoav Goldberg
- Examines counterfactual data augmentation to address gender bias
**"Causal Transformers for Estimating Counterfactual Outcomes"** by Amir-Hossein Karimi et al
- Proposes a transformer-based model for estimating counterfactual outcomes
**"Causal Discovery with Reinforcement Learning"** by Yao Zhang et al
- Explores causal discovery using reinforcement learning, applicable to NLP tasks
**"Causal Intervention for Fairness in Text Classification"** by Jieyu Zhao et al
- Investigates causal interventions to improve fairness in text classification
**"Causal Inference for Text Classification with Limited Observational Data"** by Yixin Wang and
- Discusses causal inference techniques for text classification
**"Causal Analysis of Social Media Data"** by Yelena Mejova et al
- Provides insights into causal analysis of social media data, relevant for NLP applications
**"Causal Effects of Linguistic Properties"** by Yulia Tsvetkov et al
- Examines the causal effects of linguistic properties on various NLP tasks
**"Causal Inference in Multilingual NLP"** by Ivan Titov et al
- Discusses causal inference challenges and methods in multilingual NLP settings
**"Causal Inference for Natural Language Processing: A Tutorial"** by Amir Feder et al
- A tutorial-style paper introducing causal inference concepts for NLP practitioners
**"Causal Inference in Text: Estimating Causal Effects of Linguistic Properties"** by Yulia Tsvetkov et al
note: - Focuses on estimating causal effects of linguistic properties in text.
